comments:

i use the integration build from 20020205 (lastest).
i have 63 active projects, 6-10 open editors (files), Java perspective is
in use. last time the error occured i run a ant build.xml. do you need more 
info?

Alexander: How often are you seeing this?

The "No more handles" error occurs when all o/s resources are exhausted. This 
typically happens when an application fails to dispose of the resources it 
allocates.

Moving to UI for comment.

Note: Actual failure point occured during the running of StyledText code. This 
doesn't imply StyledText is to blame, but I'm adding LK to the CC list to 
investigate.

Currently this error is reproducable in my ide by 
running the following ant-file:

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<project name="de.esolver.ant" basedir="." default="release">

	<property name="dist.dir" value="../../plugins/de.esolver.ant"/>

	<target name="release">
		<jar jarfile="anttools.jar" basedir="bin"/>
		<mkdir dir="${dist.dir}"/>
		<copy file="anttools.jar" todir="${dist.dir}"/>
		<copy file="plugin.xml" todir="${dist.dir}"/>
	</target>
	
</project>

the target-selector appears, after pressing run the error occurs.
i will try, if it is a generell ant-runner problem with another ant-file.

o.k. i tried another ant-script, which used to run in another version of
eclipse. it takes nearly 1 minute until the target-selector appears,
after pressing Finish, i get a dialog-box saying:

A SWT error has occured. .... Exit Workbench?

The log says (the same as yesterday):

the error message-box appears until i press yes to exit.
so it seems to be a problem with ant-runner.

Asked KR to investigate.  It could be that the Ant code is leaking resources 
and by the time something is to be written to the Ant console via StyledText, 
no more handles are around.

Actually on second thought, I think the Ant team should look into this.  Based 
on the information in the PR, it is most likely not a StyledText problem.

Compared changes we made since 1/15 and there's nothing suspicious that could 
have introduced a leak.
The Ant team should look into why it takes so long for the target dialog to 
appear (assuming it also takes a long time for simple ant scripts) and whether 
they are leaking any resources. The Ant Console may be leaking Colors when 
setting styles in the StyledText widget.
Assigning to Ant team.

Note: I also don't believe that the problem is StyledText. It just seemed like 
it was worth taking a look at the stack trace to see if something obvious was 
wrong.

build 2002-02-05 on Win98.

These are the steps that I used:
- install new 2002-02-05 image (create shortcut to java.exe, etc etc)
- start eclipse
- create Java project
- create resource foo.xml with the contents:
    <?xml version="1.0"?>
    <project name="de.esolver.ant" basedir="." default="release">
      <property name="dist.dir" value="../../plugins/de.esolver.ant"/>
      <target name="release">
        <jar jarfile="anttools.jar" basedir="bin"/>
        <delete dir="${dist.dir}"/>
        <mkdir dir="${dist.dir}"/>
        <copy file="anttools.jar" todir="${dist.dir}"/>
        <copy file="plugin.xml" todir="${dist.dir}"/>
      </target>
    </project>
- open a context menu on foo.xml
- select Run Ant
- target dialog appears quickly (no delay)
- task runs to completion
- I am able to run this several times without problems

Which build are you using? You see the error behaviour when you first start up 
and run the Ant task? Or are you only seeing it after a while? How many 
perspectives and views do you have open? How many projects are in your 
workspace? Please provide as much information as you can so we can try and 
reproduce the problem.

In the meantime we will review Ant UI code and use of StyledText.

According the steps: this is the way i did it except:
- target dialog appears after app. 30-60 sec. on every ant-script i have
- after pressing Finish on some scripts the An SWT error dialog appears,
  on others (like the one you testet), there are several dialogs, which
  disappears fast before the ide is closing

my environment:
- currently last integeration build 20020205, but: i started with
  a stable build, and always copied my workspace to every integration build
  that was released. i always use the latest ide, but the workspace is moved
  (including the .metadata directory)
- open perspectives: one, due to an "error", the ide always relaces the open
  one, when changing or selecting another
- open editors: i tried zero up to ten, doesn't matter
- projects: currently 63, my workspace's size is 528mb including code,
  classes and resources

ok, i hope this helps. i will try the following: because i have other 
strange behaviours e.g. in team-module, i will use a brand new version
of 20020205-build and copy the workspace without the .metadata, i assume
that i will loose all settings, but sometimes i think that the settings
contains invalid or broken data. i will post the results.

Moving to Platform UI (External Tools) to verify if still an issue in the new 
implementation.
